channel.title: LatAm Prompt News Feed
channel.description: A daily digest of curated Latin American news.

item.title: LatAm Prompt News Feed - September 05, 2025
item.author: LatAm Prompt News Feed
item.description:
How to counter China’s AI push in Latin America —

U.S. must offer the region a democratic alternative before Beijing’s technology becomes entrenched.

New ‘golden triangle’ of fentanyl and guns spans US-Mexico border —

Report links Arizona-Sonora smuggling to rising homicide and overdose deaths in both countries A new “golden triangle” of fentanyl and gun trafficking between Mexico and the US ties together the homicide and overdose crises of the two countries, according to a a new study. The triangle spans Baja, California, Sinaloa and Sonora – the three states where almost all fentanyl seizures in Mexico take place – and connects to Arizona through a quieter part of the US-Mexico border that has become a hotspot for trafficking in both directions. Continue reading...

America’s War on Terror Comes to the Caribbean —

The Trump administration seems to be betting that Americans are so inured to the war on terrorism that they’ll be indifferent to extrajudicial executions.

Anatomy of a coup plot: why Jair Bolsonaro is on trial —

The former Brazilian president and seven of his closest allies are awaiting judgment – and Bolsonaro’s conviction is considered highly likely Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva was days away from taking office for his third term as the Brazilian president when soldiers from a special operations unit allegedly discussed the best way to kill him – possibly through poisoning or administering drugs that would trigger “organ failure”. Investigators would later conclude that the supposed plan to assassinate the president-elect, his vice-president and a supreme court justice was one of many strands of a wider plot designed to keep the far-right leader Jair Bolsonaro in power. Continue reading...

A $125bn scheme to save the world’s rainforests —

Brazil’s flagship initiative for COP30 is ambitious and innovative — but will face risks
